acute_aquatic_toxicity.hazard_name: Hazardous to the aquatic environment Acute
acute_aquatic_toxicity.rationale: It was classified into Category 2 from 96 hours LC50=1.3mg/L of the fish (Fathead Minnows) (CERI/NITE Hazard Assessment Report (2004) and others.).

acute_toxicity_inhalation_dust.hazard_name: Acute toxicity Inhalation: Dusts and mists

acute_toxicity_inhalation_gas.rationale: Due to the fact that the substance is "solid" according to the GHS definition and inhalation of its gas is not expected.

acute_toxicity_oral.rationale: Based on the LD50 value of 557mg/kg calculated from the testing data of rat LD50 650mg/kg, 707mg/kg, 616mg/kg (DFGOT vol.6 (1994)) and 517mg/kg (MOE Risk Assessment vol. 4 (2005)).

carcinogenicity.rationale:
No data available
As for the health hazards, refer to "ID413, Dinitrotoluene, CAS: 25321-14-6."

chronic_aquatic_toxicity.hazard_name: Hazardous to the aquatic environment Long-term
chronic_aquatic_toxicity.hazard_statement: Toxic to aquatic life with long lasting effects
chronic_aquatic_toxicity.rationale: Although acute toxicity was Category 2 and the bio-accumulation potential was low (log Kow=2.18(PHYSPROP Database, 2005)), since there was no rapidly degrading (the decomposition by BOD: 0%(CERI/NITE Hazard Assessment Report, 2004)), it was classified into Category 2.

corrosive_to_metals.rationale: Classified into Division 6.1 (UN#3454 Dinitrotoluene (solid) and 1600 Dinitrotoluene (molten)) (UN Recommendations on the Transport of Dangerous Goods).

explosives.rationale: Because of a lack of data on the kick-off temperature and decomposition energy (though the substance contains nitro groups, with its oxygen budget calculated at -114). Classified into Division 6.1 (UN#3454 Dinitrotoluene (solid) and UN#1600 Dinitrotoluene (molten)) (UN Recommendations on the Transport of Dangerous Goods).

flammable_gases.hazard_name: Flammable gases including chemically unstable gases
flammable_gases.rationale: Classified as "solid" according to GHS definition

flammable_liquids.rationale: Classified as "solid" according to GHS definition

flammable_solids.rationale: Classification not possible due to lack of data, though classified as flammable according to HSDB (2006). Classified into Division 6.1 (UN#3454 Dinitrotoluene (solid) and UN#1600 Dinitrotoluene (molten)) (UN Recommendations on the Transport of Dangerous Goods).

gases_under_pressure.rationale: Classified as "solid" according to GHS definition

germ_cell_mutagenicity.rationale:
No data available
As for the health hazards, refer to "ID413, Dinitrotoluene, CAS: 25321-14-6."

oxidizing_gases.rationale: Classified as "solid" according to GHS definition

oxidizing_liquids.rationale: Classified as "solid" according to GHS definition

oxidizing_solids.rationale: No data available, though being organic compounds containing oxygen bound to elements other than carbon and hydrogen. Classified into Division 6.1 (UN#3454 Dinitrotoluene (solid) and 1600 Dinitrotoluene (molten)) (UN Recommendations on the Transport of Dangerous Goods).

pyrophoric_liquids.rationale: Classified as "solid" according to GHS definition

pyrophoric_solids.rationale: Classified into Division 6.1 (UN#3454 Dinitrotoluene (solid) and 1600 Dinitrotoluene (molten)) (UN Recommendations on the Transport of Dangerous Goods).

reproductive_toxicity.rationale:
No data available
As for the health hazards, refer to "ID413, Dinitrotoluene, CAS: 25321-14-6."

self_heating_substances.rationale: Test methods applicable to liquid substances are not available (melting point: 52.5degC (HSDB, 2006), test temperature: 140degC).

self_reactive_substances.rationale: No data available, though the substance contains nitro groups with explosive properties. Classified into Division 6.1 (UN#3454 Dinitrotoluene (solid) and 1600 Dinitrotoluene (molten)) (UN Recommendations on the Transport of Dangerous Goods).

serious_eye_damage_irritation.rationale:
No data available
As for the health hazards, refer to "ID413, Dinitrotoluene, CAS: 25321-14-6."

skin_corrosion_irritation.rationale:
No data available.
As for the health hazards, refer to "ID413, Dinitrotoluene, CAS: 25321-14-6."

substances_mixtures_emit_flammable_gas_i.hazard_name: Substances and mixtures which, in contact with water, emit flammable gases
substances_mixtures_emit_flammable_gas_i.rationale: Containing no metals or metalloids (B, Si, P, Ge, As, Se, Sn, Sb, Te, Bi, Po, At)

systemic_toxicity_repeat_exposure.hazard_name: Specific target organ toxicity - Repeated exposure
systemic_toxicity_repeat_exposure.rationale:
Classification not possible due to lack of data on 2,5-dinitrotoluene per se.
Refer to "Dinitrotoluene (CAS_25321-14-6)."

systemic_toxicity_single_exposure.hazard_name: Specific target organ toxicity - Single exposure
systemic_toxicity_single_exposure.hazard_statement: May cause drowsiness or dizziness (narcotic effects)
systemic_toxicity_single_exposure.rationale:
Based on the evidence of "somnolency" from animal studies (RTECS (2006)).
Refer to "Dinitrotoluene (CAS_25321-14-6)."
